column2: P5JS - Painting with Sound - Part 3
What you'll do
In the last part of this set of quests, you'll put together all the elements you've used so far to get things really crazy!
Welcome back, {{user_name}}! Are you ready to put on a real light show? I know I am!

First things first - let's get back to the p5.js code editor. You can load your previous sketch (if you saved it at http://editor.p5js.org), or get back to where we left off with this one: https://editor.p5js.org/madetohack/sketches/HNfYgEbV
Last time, we learned how to detect louder elements and use that in a creative way.
Now, let's add some more elements to the mix.
Let's create another condition that says if the volume is greater than 0.2 then draw a line with a random color, from a random X, Y location to another random X,Y location!
Ok, that sounds like a lot, but we can break it down into pieces.
First let's create our if condition statment: if (volume > 0.2) { }
Inside it let's create a line();
A line expects four numbers. The first two numbers are the X and Y coordinates for where the line starts and the next two numbers are the X and Y coordinates for where the line ends.
We can use random(width) for our two X coordinates and random(height) for our two Y coordinates.
So, all together, that should be line(random(width), random(height), random(width), random(height));
line is different from circle - you can't fill lines with color. Instead, we have to change the stroke, or outline, of our line.
While we are adding a stroke, let's use our random R, G, B values that we set up last time.
Add the line stroke(r, g, b); above the line(random(width), random(height), random(width), random(height));
Now let's make our stroke thicker by adding the line: strokeWeight(5);
Run this and see what happens!
Try experimenting by changing the 5 in strokeWeight(5) to another value.
Now that we have a music painter going, put on some tunes and watch your creation go! Party time!
